page.title: 01Rhyl: town and countryside
page.content: Rhyl town is probably best known as a seaside resort,lying on the North Wales coast.The town has a{population} of around 20,000 and at the height of the summer season it may triple in size. The town lies on what was a small hill about one mile from the shore.The towns origional name was'yrhyl' meaning a hill.Beyond Rhyl is a chain of small towns leading further inland to the{Clwydian}range of mountains.The upland{farms}rely upon{government}grants to support livestock production.The Clwyd valley farms are generally dairy farms. Moving eastwards from Rhyl along the coast the towns are more industrialised.The highly polluted River Dee flows into the sea along this stretch of coast.Along its shores is the Point of Ayr Colliery, where coal is mined from beneath the sea bed
